dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nestled in a dark forest. Through the window, we see the figure of Ash picking up a book from a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I first saw the damn thing at that blasted cabin. The Necronomicon. An ancient Sumarrian text, bound in human flesh and inked in human blood. It contained bizarre burial rites, prophesies...and instruction for demon resurrection. It was never meant for the world of the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash flips through the pages from the BOOK OF THE DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book awoke something dark in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: BOOK OF THE DEAD
dialogues.text: inscribed on the pages.  Illustrations of demonic faces w white eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take the point of view of a wind-like demon, swooping through the woods toward the cabin.  CAMERA rips through cabin door and comes upon a SCREAMING Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got into my hand and it went bad.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S POSSESSED HAND
dialogues.text: twisting into a claw, before the flashing thunder clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I lopped it off at the wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASH severs his hand from his wrist with the chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: BLOOD RED CLOUDS
dialogues.text: sweep past the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to rid myself of the foul thing, I read from a passage in the book that was supposed to open a hole.  A hole in Time that would send the Evil back. And it worked.

dialogues.speaker: A BANDAGED, ONE HANDED ASH
dialogues.text: recites the incantation from the Necronomicon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Time vortex is created.  Trees and a 1973 Delta 88 Oldsmobile are sucked up into the funnel cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I just didn't plan on coming along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash, now armed with shotgun and chainsaw, is swallowed by funnel-cloud of the Time vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash is rocketing through a funnel of swirling clouds.  He swept away from us, hand over foot, through the dark void Time.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATION
dialogues.text: swirls through blackness as a chorus of women's voices bu to eerie crescendo, from a musical note to a SCREAM.  The swirls, pulls in upon itself, like a thing alive, and for words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke is wisked away, then reforms as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The title billows past CAMERA REVEALING...

dialogues.speaker: A GRANDFATHER CLOCK
dialogues.text: its hands winding backwards at an insane rate, spins angr past, revealing other debris that has been swept up into funnel cloud. Tumbling weightless through this void we fi

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS but there is no sound. No scream. Only the ste BEATING of his heart.

dialogues.speaker: ASH FRONT SCREEN PROJECTION
dialogues.text: He shields his eyes from a sudden bright light.  The funn cloud electrifies.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S BODY
dialogues.text: RIPS at the fabric of Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet.  Then, an electrical disturbance in the sha a human body flashes briefly and is gone.  A moment latte appears and tumbles from the sky, falling past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASH falls to the dust.  His double barrelled shotgun land beside him.  The '73 Oldsmobile comes CRASHING to the gro a moment later.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: looks up from the dust to behold...

dialogues.speaker: TWENTY-FIVE MOUNTED HORSEMEN
dialogues.text: in 12th century armor ride up over a hill.  They halt bef Ash.

dialogues.speaker: WARRIOR
dialogues.text: thrusts his longsword into the air, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail to him who has come from the sky to deliver us from the terror of the Deadites!  Hail!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: stares in confusion at the strange medieval figures.

dialogues.speaker: TWENTY-FIVE WARRIOR
dialogues.text: join in the chant and hail Ash, but suddenly stop as...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: the muscular commander of the group, gallops his horse in frame, followed by FOUR HORSEMEN who are his lieutenants. lifts his iron visor and evaluates Ash. 26         ARTHUR'S P.O.V. The Delta 88 Oldsmobile. The chainsaw, strapped to Ash's The handless stump of Ash's right arm.  The Shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: A FRIGHTENED ASH
dialogues.text: waves a shaky hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take is easy now chief. I don't know how I got here and I'm not lookin' for any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WISEMAN JOHN
dialogues.text: An elderly man, in a long black cloak, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Lord Arthur, I believe he is the promised one, written of in the Necronomicon.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Brings his sword down across Ash's chest. Ash cries out i as...

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S CHEST
dialogues.text: is cut. A thin red gash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bleeds.  As a man bleeds.  The one written of in the Book would not bleed.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR GESTURES
dialogues.text: and CAMERA PANS to four prisoners bound in iron shackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likely, he is one of Henry's men. I say to the pit with him!  If he is truly the promised one... he will emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye!  The pit's a fair test!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: charges his horse at Ash. But he is met with the wooden s of Ash's shotgun as it swings into frame, cracking agains jaw.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST HORSEMAN
dialogues.text: is moving fast when he hits the ground. His armored form end over end in the dust, clanging to a halt against a ro

He thrusts his chainsaw arm outward, pulling on the start cord; PUTT-PUTT-PUTT... The engine won't turn over.  He c and yanks again.

dialogues.text: is knocked from his steed.  He tumbles to the dust, narro escaping his own horse's hooves.

dialogues.text: rolls to his feet and spins to the sound of approaching h

dialogues.text: bounces along the rocky ground, kicking up dust.

dialogues.text: Picks up the chainsaw and sawed off shotgun from the dust is troubled by the strange objects. Sunlight glints off t blade of the chainsaw, blinding the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Her face does not immediately register the grief.  She at to step forward but stumbles.  She steadies herself again stone wall. Her eyes harden as she sees the first of the shackled prisoners: a semi-conscious Ash. She flushes with anger and races up to him. She spits and at him as he's dragged along.

dialogues.text: halt. Iron keys rattle. The shackles are unlocked. Ash an prisoners rub their reddened wrists. They are pushed at swordpoint towards a circular iron grate that sits atop t ground. This is THE PIT.

dialogues.text: eyes Ash curiously.  This is Duke Henry the Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sir, are not one of my vassals.  Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Henry the Red. Duke of Shale. Lord of the Northlands and leader of its people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't leadin' but two things now, pal. Jack and shit.  And Jack left town.

dialogues.text: address the doomed men:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an Evil that has awakened in this land.  And whilst my people fight for their very souls against it, you, Duke Henry the Red, wage war on us. Your people are no better than the foul corruption that lies in the bowels of that pit!  May God have mercy on your souls.

dialogues.speaker: TWO OF ARTHUR'S MEN
dialogues.text: crank a massive wench.  Chains tighten and the heavy iron slides back, revealing a dark hole.  The Pit.

dialogues.text: a echoed wailing rises up.

dialogues.text: stiffen in fear.

dialogues.text: as he's thrown down into the pit.  He disappears into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Cheers.  They turn their attention to the remaining priso CAMERA PANS from their bloodthirsty faces to the next pri in line...

dialogues.text: trying to hear what the Wiseman is saying. His head jolts backward, barely avoiding the beast's wild swing. Ash squ to discern Wiseman John throwing something down to him: a object falling at him through the glare above.

The crowds gasp is cut short by....BLAMMITY-BLAM! The shotgun belches flame. The blast cuts the chain, leav the Deadite teetering at the pit's edge.

dialogues.text: look to Ash in reverence.

dialogues.text: fly from a barren tree.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A massive grouping of freestanding rectangular stones, ea twenty feet tall.  The remains of an ancient temple.  In center of the ruins there burns a roaring bonfire.  As ol stirs a cauldron atop the flames.  Nearby, Arthur convers his four Lieutenants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: opens his mouth to allow a spoonful of food to enter.  No has he swallowed then a piece of fruit is offered.  He wa it away with a satisfied burp and turns to drink from a g on wine, brought to his lips by a female hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: is dresses in a revealing tunic. She looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pray thee to forgive me.  I believed thee one of Henry's men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches Ash's hand. Ash turns away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you wanta kill me, now ya wanna kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spits out a mouthful of grape seeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry m'lord. Please understand... T'is a cruel time for us. The Wisemen say you are the promised one. Our only hope against the darkness that has descended on this land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares deeply into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not.  I feel that there is reason for your being here. It is no accident.

dialogues.speaker: WISEMAN JOHN AND TWO OTHER CLOAKED WISEMEN
dialogues.text: approach.  They sit in tall stone chairs across the fire Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what is it?  Can you send me back or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the Necronomicon has the power.  A power which we both require. It contains passages that can dispel the Evil from this place and return you to your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Necronomicon. Yeah, that's the thing that got me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is in a place far from here. It can only be retrieved by the Promised one. Other Warriors have tried.  Their widows grieve still. We have waited long years for you. Out only hope is the Necronomicon. Thou must undertake to quest for it.  Alone must thou travel to a distant cemetery. There thou shalt find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Now way, no day. Only place I'm goin' is home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden gust of wind whips up the flames of the fire.

dialogues.text: turn to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: now standing too close to the fire.  Her robes ignites. not respond as flames sweep up her body. She continues to the caldron.

dialogues.text: His haw drops.  He slowly stands as...

dialogues.text: spins sharply to him.  Her voice changes as she SHRIEKS;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU SHALL DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are bone white.  She is POSSESSED by the dark sp Her burning body is violently jerked about in the air by invisible hands. Her blackened lips pull back in a wild a snarl. With two voice at once;

dialogues.text: rolls, and comes to a halt at Ash's feet.  It's eyes pop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Now you see what's what.  Man's body is his own personal property. Don't anybody try to take that away from him.

dialogues.text: It's eyes dart, looking for something on it's face when a shovelful of dirt is heaped atop it.

dialogues.text: as a shovelful of dirt is heaped atop the CAMERA.

dialogues.text: In the center, lies a massive slab of black stone.

dialogues.text: draws closer, his teeth chattering as the wind blasts at He glances down to...

dialogues.text: sitting atop the ground, leering up at CAMERA with empty sockets. The wind whistles through the empty skull.  The bone drops open with a squeak.

dialogues.text: His hair is whipped up by the wind. He looks to...

dialogues.text: backlit by the rising moon, creates eerie beams of light shadow.

dialogues.text: arrives at the foot of the massive stone.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCRANKED
dialogues.text: Atop it sits... THE BOOK OF THE DEAD. 376        CAMERA PANS REVEALING...

dialogues.text: Wait.  Three books?  Nobody said anything about that. Ha!  That Wiseman was so busy fillin' me fulla his secret words and phrases and, and, his... bullshit, he forgot to mention anything about that.  Like do I take all of 'em of one or 'em, or what?  Well...

dialogues.speaker: WHOOOOOOSH
dialogues.text: To reveal a black hole.  SCREAMS ERUPT from the dark abys the Book. It begins to suck things into it.

dialogues.text: He turns to study...

dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.text: Swooping erratically around Ash's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   The words.  Say the words. KLATOO!... VERATA...  uh...  Uh... Necta... uh... Nectar... Necktie... uh...

dialogues.text: He hesitates, then calls out boldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KLATOO... VERATA... NECTtphhhhhhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He deliberately muffles the last word that he can't remem The wind stops.  It seems to have worked.  He looks about growing confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then.

dialogues.text: A tiny figure among the gravestones which tremble and one one are thrust from the earth.

dialogues.text: last out and snag Ash's tongue between their boney pincer shutting Ash up.  With his tongue held, he tries to speak but the other skeletal hand slaps him, shutting him up. hands work double-time at slapping him.

dialogues.text: reach for him, but he is too fast.  He stamps on one of t skeletal arms, pinning it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a snarl) Keep you damn filthy bones outta my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP!  He breaks the boney arm in two and runs away from of limbs. A bone arm rips from the grave and reaches for Book of the Dead but Ash scoops it up first.  He leaps ov another set of groping arms that rip from the ground!

dialogues.text: galloping back the way he came. In the distance we see th cemetery. More bodies arise from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now far from the danger but still he rides hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through bein' their garbage boy.  I did my part of the bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pats the saddlebag, where the book is and grins. Now they owe me.  Like in the deal.  I want back.

dialogues.text: He whips his horse... HA!  GIIDDUP NOW!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: swings down.

dialogues.text: hold Ash's horse as he dismounts. There are excited shout the villagers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Necronomicon.  Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: pours a bucket of water over his head and begins drinking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the Necronomicon!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: slurps down more of the water, averting his eyes from the Wiseman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's just that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash produces the Necronomicon. Now send be back. Like in the deal.

dialogues.speaker: WISEMAN JOHN
dialogues.text: takes the book and suddenly goes pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...I sensed something had gone awry. The book's power. It's gone.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: murmurs at this bad news.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: suddenly looks very guilty. Wiseman John turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you removed the Necronomicon from it's cradle, did you speak the words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  basically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you speak the exact words?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe not every single syllable, no.  But basically I said them.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WISEMAN JOHN
dialogues.text: bows his head, stung by this information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dung eating fool!  Thou hast doomed us. When thou misspoke the words the Army of the Dead was awoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. We had a deal. You told me, you could clean this thing up, once I got you the book. You said there was a passage in there that could get rid of this thing and send me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passage is useless to us as long as these evil dead walk. They have a terrible desire for this book. And they shall come here to get it. Once in their possession, the Evil shall rule the Earth for one thousand years...Because of you...we are doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted the damn book. You got yer book. I did my part of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did strike a bargain. I will return you to your own time as promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well good. That was the deal.  So uh...when do you think we can...

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: looks about at the condemned faces.

dialogues.speaker: THE VILLAGERS
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS past the doomed faces in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean...when can you send me...

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: sees Sheila, but looks away, consumed with the guilt that doomed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wisemen were fools to believe that you were the Promised one. That one such as you could have saved us!.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: is solemn.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: and the others turn away in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still believe that thou wilt help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.. They're right.  I screwed up. I didn't come through for you, and...  I'm sorry for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have faith in thee. In my heart I know thou wilt still succeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila... It's over for me. I don't belong here and I'm going home. I didn't have what it took. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bows his head and moves off. A high pitched SHRIEK is heard!

dialogues.speaker: ALL HEADS
dialogues.text: look to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: TWO WINGED DEADITES
dialogues.text: possessed women with bat-like wings, swoop down.

dialogues.speaker: TEN VILLAGERS
dialogues.text: scream as they flee from the winged beasts.

dialogues.speaker: WINGED DEADITE
dialogues.text: Like a delta winged F-15, it banks towards Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: races to intercept.  He plants himself between Sheila and beast.

dialogues.speaker: WINGED DEADITE
dialogues.text: As it swoops at Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: opens his steel hand, then clamps it closed again on the of his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immense shadow of the broad winged Deadite falls over

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: swings his sword upward.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLADE
dialogues.text: severs the tip of the Beast's rotted wing.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLYING DEADITE
dialogues.text: shrieks in pain as it soars over Ash. No longer aerodynam sound, it crashes to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF WARRIORS
dialogues.text: fire their arrows into the beast, pegging it to a tree. bone white eyes of the creature darken.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND ARTHUR
dialogues.text: spin to the sound of a woman's SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: in the clutches of WINGED DEADITE #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'Lord Ash!  Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast flies off with the fair maiden, soaring over th castle wall and into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: shakes his fist at the receding beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you!

dialogues.speaker: THREE MOUNTED SCOUTS
dialogues.text: come riding in through the castle doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army of the dead!  They have gathered in the wilderness and come this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But two days ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then these winged ones are only the first of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should go from this place while we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could be safe in the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  To the mountains!  We must flee! They'll take our souls!

dialogues.speaker: BLAMMITY-BLAM
dialogues.text: All eyes look to...

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: who stands on a high castle wall, clutching his smolderin shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and run.  Run home and cry to mama.  I'm through runnin'. I stay we stay and fight.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: takes a challenging step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will we stop an army of the dead at out castle walls?  How will you fight that?!  With more words? Most of out people have already fled.  We are but forty men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get Henry the Red and his men to fight with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shall not stand in battle, alongside the likes of him. Our honor will not allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll die.  Honor and all. Now who's with me?

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: is silent as they consider Ash's words. Then from the rea Village Blacksmith steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stand by you.

dialogues.speaker: A WARRIOR
dialogues.text: steps forward. Then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may count on my steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And mine!

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: steps forward vowing their allegiance to the cause.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: reluctantly joins them.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: directs teams of skeletons to dig at the graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dig!  Dig faster!  I want every black hearted, worm infested, son of a bitch that ever died in battle! We'll storm their castle and take the book!  Then my lads, eternal life shall by ours!

dialogues.speaker: STOP MOTION ANIMATION
dialogues.text: hoist up a stone casket from the ground and with rusted s pry it open, releasing another skeleton who stands to joi ranks.

dialogues.speaker: TWO ARMORED SKELETONS
dialogues.text: push a bruised Sheila to her knees before Evil Ash.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: looking up to Evil Ash in fear. His boney finger comes do frame and strokes her lovely cheek.  She pulls away in revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: looks down at her with lust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ain't you a sweet little thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His boney digit caresses her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!  You foul thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your gonna learn to live me missy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Promised one will come for you.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETAL EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: yanks her to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlin' I'm gonna save him the trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clutches her squirming body in a boney embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouetted by the large full moon, Evil Ash forces his k upon Sheila.  Around them, the skeletons sharpen their sw on tombstones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash rides toward the castle of Henry the Red that can be in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: is suddenly intercepted by FOUR OF HENRY'S HORSEMEN.  The surround him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears the insignia of Arthur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slay him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The draw their swords when...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY THE RED
dialogues.text: rides up between his warriors and Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay your arms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T'is the stranger who spared me from the pit. What brings you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're headed towards Arthur's castle. We need your help. Fight with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are a vassal of Arthur now? You have taken up sides with him against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only side I'm takin' is the one that's gonna stop those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I endanger my people to save my enemy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because after they finish with Arthur they'll come after you. Together, we've got a chance. Besides, you owe me.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH AND SHEILA
dialogues.text: ride side by side on skeletal steeds.  Sheila lifts her b veil, revealing bone white eyes, set into a face now the of cracked leather.  She looks with admiration to...

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: He is general of the army of Deadites. He thrusts a ruste into the air and shouts in a gritty voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who rules?!

dialogues.speaker: ONE HUNDRED ARMORED SKELETONS
dialogues.text: raise their swords into the air with a shout.

dialogues.speaker: THREE TRUMPETERS
dialogues.text: stand atop the castle wall and sound their trumpets!  CAM to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: THE 1973 DELTA 88 OLDSMOBILE
dialogues.text: being pulled by a team of men and horses, inside the cast walls.  Ash is behind the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND THE BLACKSMITH
dialogues.text: look under the hood of the Delta 88, parked in the Blacks shop.

dialogues.speaker: THE DELTA'S ENGINE
dialogues.text: is shattered.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND THE BLACKSMITH
dialogues.text: pour molten iron into a large sand mold.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAND
dialogues.text: is brushed away revealing gear wheels.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMERS
dialogues.text: beat upon red hot iron, fashioning helicopter like rotor

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACKSMITH'S STOVE
dialogues.text: is lowered into the Delta's engine compartment.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: walks along, inspecting a line of forty medieval warriors stand at attention. He halts before a warrior and stares at him. The Warrior glances towards Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You eyeballin' me boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, M'Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, M'LORD!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You squeekin' like a mouse!  Are you a mouse boy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, M'LORD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from, mouse?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hail from the village of Perth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two things come from Perth: steers and queers. Which are you?

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: takes charcoal from a dead fire and chips of dried cow du He mixes them with sulfur.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK POWDER
dialogues.text: is bound up in a small satchel and affixed to an arrow.

dialogues.speaker: GOLD TOOTH
dialogues.text: lights the fuse with a torch.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: draws back and releases the arrow. ZING!

dialogues.speaker: THE ARROW
dialogues.text: imbeds in a wooden post and EXPLODES. Large pieces of woo sent flying.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR'S WARRIORS
dialogues.text: watch in awe.

dialogues.speaker: THE CASTLE BELL
dialogues.text: is rung madly.  The signal for battle stations.

dialogues.speaker: A WARRIOR
dialogues.text: rides in through the castle gates screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming!  The Deadites approach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of shock and fear on all the faces.  ASH comes int frame.  CAMERA CRANES UP with him as he scales the ladder the lookout tower. He peers out to the darkening horizon.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: hears them before he sees them: The sound of clicking bon Painful moans of tortured souls, the clanging of approach armor.

dialogues.speaker: THE HORIZON
dialogues.text: Fifty distant silhouettes of the Evil Dead appear on the horizon.  Then fifty more.

dialogues.speaker: THREE KILTED SKELETON SCOTSMEN
dialogues.text: play rotted bagpipes as they march toward the castle. A h battle melody. Behind them...

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON
dialogues.text: plays the drums upon a set of hollow skulls.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON
dialogues.text: takes a leg bone upon a third skeleton's ribs. A bone xyl A bone-o-phone.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON
dialogues.text: blow into arm bones forming woodwind section.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR VIKING SKELETONS
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKING with these helmeted skeletons as they mar They are clad in rusting suits of armor, wielding swords spears.  Nasty grins on their faces. One hobbles past on wooden leg.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH AND SHEILA
dialogues.text: ride their steeds to a halt atop a hill.

dialogues.speaker: A SKELETON AND DEADITE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: ride alongside Evil Ash and salute him sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'Lord!  We are positioned on both fronts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they keeping my book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most likely...there, in the castle's keep. It would be the safest place.  It is behind two walls that must be taken first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: With a sweep of his arm, he waves the Army of rot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward!

dialogues.speaker: THE MACABRE MARCHING BAND
dialogues.text: now pound the attack beat on their drums.

dialogues.speaker: A LINE OF DEADITES
dialogues.text: advance toward the castle. Some crouch behind wooden barr which they roll before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load!

dialogues.speaker: TWELVE ARCHERS
dialogues.text: pull back arrows on their bow strings.  Each arrow has a charge of black powder attached to it. Torch boy!

dialogues.speaker: A TORCH BOY
dialogues.text: runs behind the archers, lighting the fuses on each of th powder charges. As the last arrow is lit....

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: looks to the approaching army.

dialogues.speaker: THE LINE OF DEADITES
dialogues.text: rolls their wooden barricades closer.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: turns to Ash for the signal.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: holds up a finger.  He waits.

dialogues.speaker: TWELVE ARCHERS
dialogues.text: strain, their bows taut with the explosive arrows.  The s of the FUSE BURNING is loud.

dialogues.speaker: THE BURNING FUSES
dialogues.text: about to disappear into the powder charges.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: waits one more beat.  The turns to Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: TWELVE ARCHERS
dialogues.text: fire a volley of smoking arrows.

dialogues.speaker: SMOKING AND SPUTTERING ARROWS
dialogues.text: rain down from the castle wall.

dialogues.speaker: TWO WOODEN BARRICADES
dialogues.text: are hit with the explosive arrows. They explode.

dialogues.speaker: THREE DEADITES
dialogues.text: are pierced by the explosive arrows.  BOOM!  BOOM!  BOOM! apart in flames.

dialogues.speaker: FLAMING DEADITES
dialogues.text: roll on the ground unable to extinguish themselves.

dialogues.speaker: A BURNING SKELETON
dialogues.text: continues to advance only to collapse into a smoldering h

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS
dialogues.text: CHEER Ash in sensurround.

dialogues.speaker: A SCOUT
dialogues.text: races up to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'Lord!  A second division approaching from the South.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: turns to the South.

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND WAVE A DEADITES
dialogues.text: approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATAPULTS...SOUTH!

dialogues.speaker: THREE WOODEN CATAPULTS
dialogues.text: are wheeled into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powder!

dialogues.speaker: GOLD TOOTH AND OTHER WARRIORS
dialogues.text: hoist large sacks of black powder onto spoons of the cata Their fuses are lit.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: gestures. Swords slice through lines which send giant sac black powder catapulting.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE
dialogues.text: Three flaming projectiles whine as they hurl over the cas walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CRANING DOWN toward the skeletons as they look upw in horror. BOOM!  The first blast takes out a skeleton horse and rid fly. BOOM!  FOUR DEADITES are obliterated.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: turns to the Skeleton Captain #1 who rides alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to regroup, m'Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't bother.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: slices off the head of Skeleton Captain #1. He turns to t MOUNTED DEADITE next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now my captain. I will now allow anything to stop me from possessing the Necronomicon. Get me into that castle.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEW DEADITE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: gulps and races forward into the ranks shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAM THE GATES!

dialogues.speaker: TWO GROUPS OF FOUR SKELETONS
dialogues.text: use trees as battering rams and batter the large wooden d of the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: begin to buckle beneath the hammering blows.

dialogues.speaker: TWO VILLAGE WOMEN
dialogues.text: scream!

dialogues.speaker: TEN WARRIORS
dialogues.text: wedge logs to buttress the buckling castle doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrows!

dialogues.speaker: A ROW OF SIX SKELETAL ARCHERS
dialogues.text: fire a volley of arrows. As they reload. Behind them...

dialogues.speaker: A SECOND LINE OF SIX SKELETAL ARCHERS
dialogues.text: fire their arrows.

dialogues.speaker: A VOLLEY OF DEADITES' ARROWS
dialogues.text: pierce five Warriors atop the castle wall. They fall.

dialogues.speaker: TWO DEAD WARRIORS
dialogues.text: fall to the courtyard. Villagers lift them away on stretc

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: shouts to Ash:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Henry?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he will not. But know this.  No matter how this battle fares, I was wrong to think you a coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battering rams rips through the doors and the army of darkness pours into the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: A LEGLESS SKELETON
dialogues.text: crawls in with a knife in its teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming in. What now?!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: looks terrified. He turns and runs from the castle entran dropping his sword, and hides in the blacksmith's shop, p the door closed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: shocked at Ash's cowardly desertion, turns to his men and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall back!  Man the Parapet!  Protect the book or God save us all!

dialogues.speaker: THE WARRIORS
dialogues.text: retreat across the courtyard to rope ladders that scale t parapet.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR'S MEN CLIMB ATOP THE PARAPET
dialogues.text: The rope ladders are hastily pulled up, leaving no access

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are stranded in the courtyard. They fight for their lives are quickly overcome.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL SHEILA
dialogues.text: takes out the last of the stranded warriors with her swor

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: smiles at Sheila. He turns his attention to the guarded t just beyond the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book shall be mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his rusty sword. LADDERS!

dialogues.speaker: TWELVE EVIL DEAD
dialogues.text: storm the parapet with three crudely built wooden ladders large rocks rain down upon them from above.

dialogues.speaker: TWO WARRIORS
dialogues.text: push away ladder #1.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SKELETONS ON LADDER
dialogues.text: swing away from the wall and crash to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TWO SKELETONS ON LADDER
dialogues.text: leap onto the parapet and battle the men with swords.

dialogues.speaker: WARRIOR
dialogues.text: knocks the deadite off the ledge and shouts back toward A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't hold this wall much longer!

dialogues.speaker: A DEADITE ARROW
dialogues.text: pierces his armor and he falls to his death.

dialogues.speaker: A VIKING DEADITE
dialogues.text: looks up as he hears...

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORS OF THE BLACKSMITH'S SHOP BURST OPEN
dialogues.text: Through the dust and smoke something appears...An iron beast...belching steam...It's angry iron blades whirling. Behold...

dialogues.speaker: THE DEATHCOASTER
dialogues.text: The stripped chaise of the Delta  88 Oldsmobile. A steam is mounted to it's center to power the craft. At the fron rear are spinning, helicopter like rotor blades.

dialogues.speaker: GOLD TOOTH
dialogues.text: shovels coal into the Deathcoaster's furnace.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: is at the helm. He pulls a cord.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEATHCOASTER'S STEAM WHISTLE
dialogues.text: SCREAMS to announce its birth.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIKING DEADITE
dialogues.text: is cut to ribbons by swirling blades.

dialogues.speaker: THE VILLAGERS ATOP THE PARAPET
dialogues.text: cheer!

dialogues.speaker: EVIL DEAD
dialogues.text: at the base of the ladders look up in horror to see...

dialogues.speaker: THE STEAM DRIVEN ROTOR BLADES
dialogues.text: slicing through two Deadites at once. The cow-catcher in pushes aside the halved Evil Dead.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: operates a crude instrument panel with only two levers to the craft. It's a bumpy ride.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEATHCOASTER
dialogues.text: Thwop!  Thwop!  Two more skeletons bite the dust. leathery hands pluck a SCREAMING Gold Tooth from the craf

dialogues.speaker: GOLD TOOTH
dialogues.text: disappears beneath the squirming corpses. A moment later emerges as a skeleton himself, except for the single gold that shines against the white of the bone. He stands and the Deadites.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL SHEILA
dialogues.text: leaps onto the moving Deathcoaster to face Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thou didst find me beautiful once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey...You got real ugly.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL SHEILA
dialogues.text: attacks with a SHRIEK!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: spins out his double barreled shot gun and...

dialogues.speaker: BLAMMITY-BLAM
dialogues.text: ...blows her off the craft. She does a back flip into the Deadites.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: pulls hard on the steering stick and it tears loose from craft.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEATHCOASTER
dialogues.text: careens out of control.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: tumbles from the helm and hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEATHCOASTER
dialogues.text: flips, crushes a group of Deadites against a wall, and ex

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: picks himself up from the dust. He looks upward to...

dialogues.speaker: LADDER
dialogues.text: attempts to push the ladder away. A sword comes up into f stabbing Arthur. He is yanked to his death with a shriek! Ash, with his bloody sword, leaps up from the ladder and the parapet. He's headed for the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW IN THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: races to a set of ropes and pulley that ascend the parape deadites come at him. He grabs the rope with his steel ha slices one end of it with his sword.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE HIM
dialogues.text: plummet down atop the two deadites, crushing them. Simultaneously, Ash is tanked upward by the rope, to the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: looks to...

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: approaching the Necronomicon.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: kicks aside a hay bale and removes a mini-crossbow with f flame tipped arrows, loaded and ready. He fires.

dialogues.speaker: A FLAME ARROW
dialogues.text: imbeds in Evil Ash's leg and ignites his body. Another fl dart hits his shoulder blade. The flames consume his body burns and SHRIEKS!

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: watches in horror as...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLAMES RECEED
dialogues.text: revealing a bone white skeleton with mismatched eyes. SKE EVIL ASH!  It races at Ash with a SHRIEK.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: bring their swords together with such great force that sp fly.  Ash is forced back against the stone pedestal that the Necronomicon.

dialogues.speaker: CLANG
dialogues.text: With a deft stroke, Ash's sword is flung from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ASH'S SWORD
dialogues.text: imbeds in a wooden beam.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: grabs the Necronomicon, then swings his sword at Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: grabs a burning iron torch from its mount.

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH
dialogues.text: Man and Skeleton battle with flaming torch and sword.

dialogues.speaker: KLANG
dialogues.text: The torch is knocked from Ash's hand. It falls over the e of the wall and lands in the courtyard below. It ignites The burning fuse leads to a sack of black powder. The sac upon the spoon of a catapult. 600        ABOVE...

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON ASH
dialogues.text: swings his sword. Ash leaps over the blade. The Skeleton downward, and Ash side steps it.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: rabbit punches CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON HEAD
dialogues.text: Ash's fist bursts out all it's rotted teeth.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: delivers a right hook, spinning the skeleton's head aroun a circle.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKELETON
dialogues.text: gives Ash a backwards roundhouse kick to the face. Ash tu over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: falls to the courtyard below, alongside the catapult. He at the burning fuse.

dialogues.speaker: EVIL ASH
dialogues.text: leaps from the parapet and lands atop the catapult. The S looks down at Ash with a nasty grin of bone.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON ASH
dialogues.text: Behold... He gestures to the Evil Dead that overrun the parapet and battle the last twenty of Arthur's warriors for control o Keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends the Necronomicon to taunt Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I possess the Necronomicon. I've crushed your pathetic army. Now I'll have my vengeance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his sword for the death blow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Henry's men!  They've come!

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND THE SKELETON
dialogues.text: turn... A jubilant CHEER rises from the castle as...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE HENRY THE RED AND FIFTY OF HIS MEN
dialogues.text: thunder down the hill, across the drawbridge and into the courtyard to attack the Deadites!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKELETON
dialogues.text: turns back to Ash and raises his sword for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: has grabbed a sword from a fallen warrior. With a single he slices the hand that holds the Necronomicon from Skele Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: snags the book with one hand and on the backswing, slices through the rope, springing the catapult.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKELETON AND BURNING SATCHEL
dialogues.text: are flung over the castle wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKELETON PROJECTILE
dialogues.text: rockets up past camera, waving its boney arms. The burnin satchel follows. BOOM!  The skeleton is blown to bits in mid air. A CHEER goes up within the castle courtyard as Henry's Wa crush the last of the Deadites.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIOUS BEAMS OF MORNING SUNLIGHT
dialogues.text: streak over the horizon. Ash enters frame. He holds the Necronomicon as he looks wearily out over the battlefield

dialogues.speaker: THE BATTLEFIELD
dialogues.text: Smoking skeletons lay scattered. Henry and Arthur's Warri work together. They toss the deadite bones and armor into bonfire.

dialogues.speaker: TWO DEADITE SKULLS
dialogues.text: engulfed by flames, crack in the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are dipped into the flame of a bonfire.  They ignite.

dialogues.speaker: THE INTEGRATED ARMY OF HENRY AND ARTHUR'S MEN
dialogues.text: Form a row of archers. They fire their flaming arrows toward the sea.

dialogues.speaker: THE ARROWS
dialogues.text: strike a wooden ship that holds the body of Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We said goodbye to Arthur.  Sure we had our problems.  But in the end, he was all right.

dialogues.speaker: ASH AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: watch the funeral pyre sail off.  It's flickering flames upon their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace was made between the two peoples.  And a new nation was formed.  They offered my a chance to stay among them and teach them. A chance to lead them.  To be King.  But Sheila was gone. Besides, I had places to go.

dialogues.speaker: THE WISEMEN
dialogues.text: mix a vat of liquid over a fire as they recite a passage the Necronomicon.  A flask is dipped into the liquid.

dialogues.speaker: WISEMAN JOHN
dialogues.text: hands the flask of liquid to Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Book tells us that each drop allows a man to sleep a century. Swallow six drops, and thou shalt awaken in thine own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash takes the flask and studies it. ...but what other choice did I have?

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: rides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to find a place to crash. For a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: with the aid of his horse, drags the Deathcoaster inside cave. He sets the horse free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YAHH!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gallops off.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: Places a black powder charge at the mouth of the cave.  H ignites the fuse and climbs into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I locked the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The powder charge blows.  The cave's entrance is sealed s with an avalanche of rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car headlights come on, piercing the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: uncorks the flask filled with the Wiseman's brew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I closed my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets six drops fall into his mouth.  One for each cent he must sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ash is unaware that an extra drop has fallen into his mou 7th drop!  Ash swallows the liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know if it was day or night. I started... to get drowsy... And I slept...

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: falls into a deep slumber.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEATHCOASTER'S HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: now in a different position. Time has passed. He needs a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And dreamed.

dialogues.speaker: THE HANDS ON ASH'S WRISTWATCH
dialogues.text: wind faster and faster, then halt and rust in time lapse photography. The leather band rots away and the watch fal Ash's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: rises then sets.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOON
dialogues.text: follows.

dialogues.speaker: A CRACK
dialogues.text: forms along the surface of the aging rock wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams last lasted centuries.

dialogues.speaker: A BARREN TREE
dialogues.text: sprouts buds, they swell forming leaves which change to t brilliant colors of fall then drop.

dialogues.speaker: A FROST
dialogues.text: covers Ash.

dialogues.speaker: ICICLES
dialogues.text: on the ceiling of the cave melt.  The water drops down on Ash's face.  He stirs.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: awakens in a heap of rusted scrap, which was once the Deathcoaster. His clothes and armor having deteriorated, buck ass naked as he staggers to the mouth of the cave. H at the rocks that block the cave's entrance.  Sunlight st into the hole he has created.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: climbs from the cave and steps into the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I awoke...

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: beholds...

dialogues.speaker: A FUTURISTIC CITY -
dialogues.text: after the next Nuclear war: a dead land. 646        ASH'S P.O.V.

dialogues.speaker: A FRACTURED CLOCK TOWER
dialogues.text: lays sprawled on its side.  The time of mankind's death f on the cracked face of the clock.

dialogues.speaker: A SHATTERED BRIDGE
dialogues.text: abruptly ends, a third of the way across a river it once spanned.  Upon it, rest heaps of futuristic, yet rusted t piled eight deep in some places. CAMERA PULLS BACK from a stunned Ash, amidst the atomized of iron and bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ....I found that I had slept too long.

dialogues.speaker: ASH
dialogues.text: is so small a dot now, and so far away, that we almost ca hear his terrified SCREAM!
